meanings.definition: To plan more effectively than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always manages to outplan her friends when organizing events.
meanings.sent2: I need to outplan my schedule to make sure I have enough time for all my tasks.
meanings.sent3: The clever squirrel decided to outplan the birds by hiding extra nuts in different places.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, you must outplan your opponent's moves to win.
meanings.sent5: To succeed in business, you must outplan your competitors and stay ahead of the game.

meanings.definition: A plan that is more effective than others.
meanings.sent1: His outplan for the project impressed everyone with its thoroughness.
meanings.sent2: The team's outplan proved to be the key to their victory in the competition.
meanings.sent3: The outplan to improve customer service involved training the staff in new techniques.
meanings.sent4: Her outplan for saving money involved creating a detailed budget and sticking to it.
meanings.sent5: The outplan to increase sales included launching a new advertising campaign.
